phrase.cizu_name: not give a tinker's curse (或 cuss 或 damn)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (first recorded in Anglo-Latin as a surname): of unknown origin

entry.def: If you tinker with something, you make some small changes to it, in an attempt to improve it or repair it.

example.ex: Instead of the Government admitting its error, it just tinkered with the problem...
example.tran: 政府没有承认错误，只是敷衍了事地处理问题。

entry.def: In former times, a tinker was a person who did not have a fixed home, but travelled from place to place mending metal pots and doing other small repair jobs.

entry.tran: (尤指爱尔兰裔的)流浪者，吉卜赛人
entry.def: Some people refer to any traveller or gipsy, especially one who is Irish, as a tinker .

means.word_mean: 1. a person who enjoys fixing and experimenting with machines and their parts
3. a traveling repairman who mends broken things (such as metal household utensils)
1. do random, unplanned work or activities or spend time idly;

sentences.sentence: "The old lady is usually mucking about in her little house"

means.word_mean: 2. work as a tinker or tinkerer

sentences.sentence: "Can you tinker with the T.V. set--it's not working right"
"She always fiddles with her van on the weekend"

means.word_mean: 胡乱修补；笨手笨脚地做某事

sentences.en: She spent the afernoon tinkering about in the garden shed.
sentences.cn: 她在花园的小棚屋里修修补补了一个下午。

sentences.en: Give my husband an old motorbike to tinker with and he’s as happy as the day is long.
sentences.cn: 修理好我丈夫的一辆老式摩托车,他会很高兴的。

means.word_mean: (尤指不起作用地)修修补补，小修理

sentences.en: He’s outside tinkering around with his bike.
sentences.cn: 他在外面捣鼓他的自行车。

sentences.en: They haven’t made any real changes to the system — they’ve just been tinkering around a bit.
sentences.cn: 他们对系统没有做出任何真正的改进—只不过是一点修修补补。
